uk.ac.uea.framework

Interface GPS

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AndroidGPS

    public interface GPS
    Interface that provides a set of common methods needed to track the user's current location. Created by Caine on 30/01/2016.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void endUpdates()
      Stops updating the device's current location.
      Location getCurrentLocation()
      Returns the device's current location.
      boolean proximityCheck(double range, Location destination)
      Returns true if the device is within a specified range of a destination.
      void setPeriod(int period)
      Sets the number of seconds between each location update.
      void startUpdates()
      Begins updating the device's current location.

    • Method Detail

      • startUpdates

        void startUpdates()
        Begins updating the device's current location. Usually called in onStart() or onResume().

      • endUpdates

        void endUpdates()
        Stops updating the device's current location. Usually called in onPause() or onStop().

      • getCurrentLocation

        Location getCurrentLocation()
        Returns the device's current location. A check must be put in place to assure the returned location is not null.
        Returns:
        The current Location of the device.

      • setPeriod

        void setPeriod(int period)
        Sets the number of seconds between each location update.
        Parameters:
        period -

      • proximityCheck

        boolean proximityCheck(double range,
                     Location destination)
        Returns true if the device is within a specified range of a destination.
        Parameters:
        range - The minimum distance required to be "within range" of the destination.
        destination - The location the device is travelling to.
        Returns:
